questions.question_text: Of the following, who is PRIMARILY responsible for applying frameworks for the governance of IT to balance the need for security controls with business requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Data stewards

Data stewards are primarily responsible for applying frameworks for the governance of IT to balance the need for security controls with business requirements. Data stewards oversee the management, quality, and use of data within an organization. As part of their responsibilities, they ensure that data governance frameworks are implemented effectively to address security concerns while meeting the needs of the business. This includes establishing policies, procedures, and controls to safeguard data assets, manage risk, and ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards.

The answer is C. Data stewards. On CGEIT Review Manuel 8th, we can see the following : .... A data Steward needs to have technical and business skills as well as an understanding of data warehousing concepts and data modeling.
A data Steward differs from a data analyst or scientist in that they handle and manage the data, whereas a data analyst retrieves the data in order to draw conclusions and insights from the information

Selected Answer: C
The answer is C. Data stewards.

Data stewards are responsible for ensuring that data is managed in a way that meets the needs of both the business and the IT department. This includes applying frameworks for the governance of IT to balance the need for security controls with business requirements.

Data scientists, data processors, and data analysts are all important roles in the management of data, but they do not have the same level of responsibility for IT governance.

Data stewards are responsible for managing an organization's data assets and ensuring that they are used effectively, efficiently, and securely. This includes applying frameworks for the governance of IT to balance the need for security controls with business requirements.

questions.question_text: What should be done FIRST when feedback indicates recently implemented software products are not meeting business unit expectations?

choices.A: Confirm user acceptance testing (UAT) was completed
choices.B: Institute a new software training program

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Request a gap analysis.

A gap analysis helps identify discrepancies between the expected performance of the software and its actual performance. It provides insights into what aspects of the software are not meeting expectations and helps in devising targeted solutions. This step is crucial before proceeding with any corrective actions such as additional training or reviewing help desk logs, as it helps in understanding the root causes of the problem. Once the gap analysis is completed, appropriate actions can be taken to address the identified gaps effectively.

Selected Answer: C
The rationale aligning with CGEIT:

A gap analysis compares the current software capability to the original business requirements and expectations. This reveals where gaps exist causing the dissatisfaction.

Understanding the precise gaps through analysis allows targeted action to address the root causes.

Reviewing UAT (A), training (B), and help logs (D) do not provide the same direct insights into underlying gaps causing the issues.

CGEIT emphasizes diagnostics like gap analysis to pinpoint where expected benefits are not being realized post-implementation. The analysis focuses efforts on areas requiring attention.

Selected Answer: A
When feedback indicates that recently implemented software products are not meeting business unit expectations, the FIRST step should be to confirm whether user acceptance testing (UAT) was completed satisfactorily (Option A). UAT is a crucial phase in the software implementation process where end-users validate that the system meets their requirements and functions as intended. Ensuring that UAT was conducted thoroughly helps identify if the software aligns with user expectations.

Selected Answer: D
The answer is Option D, Review help desk logs.

Option A, Confirm user acceptance testing (UAT) was completed, is not the best first step because it is possible for UAT to be completed successfully, but for the software to still not meet business unit expectations. This could be due to a number of factors, such as changes in the business requirements, changes in the user environment, or simply a misunderstanding of the software's capabilities.

Option D, Review help desk logs, is the better first step because it will provide a more accurate picture of the problems that users are having with the software. Once the specific problems have been identified, then it can be determined whether or not UAT was completed successfully.

In addition, reviewing the help desk logs will help to identify the root causes of the problems. This information can be used to develop a plan to address the problems.

questions.question_text: An enterprise is replacing its customer relationship management (CRM) system with a cloud-based system. Which of the following should be done FIRST when preparing for data migration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Review the enterprise data architecture

When preparing for data migration, the first step should be to review the enterprise data architecture. Understanding the existing data architecture helps identify the data sources, data models, data formats, and data relationships that need to be considered during the migration process.

Reviewing the enterprise data architecture allows the organization to assess the complexity of the data landscape, identify potential data quality issues, and determine the most suitable approach for data migration. It also helps in identifying any dependencies, constraints, or limitations that may impact the migration process.

Once the enterprise data architecture is reviewed, the organization can then proceed with establishing a data quality plan, consulting the quality assurance (QA) function, and acquiring data migration tools as needed, but reviewing the data architecture is the critical first step in the data migration preparation process.

Selected Answer: A
The FIRST step that an enterprise should take when preparing for data migration is to A. Review the enterprise data architecture.

This is because the enterprise data architecture will provide a high-level overview of the organization's data, including the data sources, data formats, and data relationships. This information will be essential for planning the data migration.

KPIs are essential metrics that help organizations measure the effectiveness and efficiency of their suppliers' services against predefined business objectives.

Selected Answer: B
B. Implement contract monitoring

Implementing contract monitoring is the best approach to help ensure future service delivery in accordance with business objectives when dealing with suppliers who have repeated downtime issues. Contract monitoring involves actively tracking and evaluating the performance of suppliers against predefined service level agreements (SLAs) and other contractual obligations.

By implementing contract monitoring, the enterprise can closely monitor the supplier's performance, including uptime, downtime, response times, and overall service quality. It allows the enterprise to hold the supplier accountable for meeting agreed-upon performance standards and taking corrective action if necessary.

Selected Answer: B
The BEST approach to help ensure future service delivery in accordance with business objectives when there are repeated downtime issues impacting the enterprise from third-party IT resources is to B. Implement contract monitoring.

This is because contract monitoring will help to ensure that the suppliers are meeting their contractual obligations. This includes meeting service level agreements (SLAs) and ensuring that the services are delivered in accordance with the agreed-upon specifications.

The BEST approach to help ensure future service delivery in accordance with business objectives when dealing with third-party IT resources that have repeated downtime issues is to implement contract monitoring.

questions.question_text: When evaluating the process for acquiring third-party IT resources, management identified several suppliers with repeated downtime issues impacting the enterprise. Which of the following is the BEST approach to help ensure future service delivery in accordance with business objectives?

An IT governance committee recently received a report indicating a scarcity of key IT skills in the marketplace to meet the core needs of the business. Reviewing which of the following would BEST help the committee respond to this situation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
In the scenario described, where there is a scarcity of key IT skills in the marketplace, reviewing the human resource strategy would be the most relevant and effective approach for the IT governance committee to respond to the situation. The human resource strategy outlines how an organization plans to attract, develop, retain, and manage its workforce to meet business objectives.
